meta.title: RelayPulse - Real-time availability matrix for API relay services
meta.description: RelayPulse - Real-time monitoring of LLM relay services worldwide for availability, latency, and sponsored routes, helping developers quickly evaluate provider quality and discover the most stable API providers. Supports connectivity checks for mainstream models such as Claude and GPT.

common.noData: No service nodes match the current filters

timeFilter.disabled24h: Time filter not available for this period

validation.startBeforeEnd: Start time must be before end time

header.tagline: Real-time availability matrix for API relay services

timeAlign.dynamicTitle: Live sliding window: Shows real-time data from the last 24 hours
timeAlign.hourTitle: Hourly aligned: Time blocks aligned to UTC hours for stable comparison

subscribe.tooltip: Subscribe to status change notifications via Telegram

empty.title: No favorites yet
empty.description: Click the ‚≠ê next to a provider name to add it to your favorites

table.heatmapHint: Click a cell for details (aggregated {{from}} ‚Üí {{to}} data points)

dataReference.title: Real Consumption Probing
dataReference.text: Probes are initiated based on actual token usage; results vary with network conditions and provider load, faithfully reflecting API response quality

neutralMaintenance.title: Open and Transparent Operations
neutralMaintenance.text: Entire codebase is open source under MIT license, self-hosting available for verification. Sponsors receive pinned display, exclusive badges, and high-frequency monitoring, but availability data remains objective and accurate

monitoringScope.title: Full-Stack Protocol Verification
monitoringScope.text: Covers TCP connectivity, RTT latency, and deep validation of response content, effectively detecting "fake alive" APIs that connect but cannot converse

liability.title: Disclaimer
liability.text: Monitoring data is for technical reference only and does not constitute endorsement of any third-party provider's credibility or financial security. Users interact with providers at their own risk

provider.pageDescription: Real-time LLM service availability monitoring for {{name}}
provider.notFoundMessage: Provider "{{slug}}" does not exist or is not yet monitored

share.copyFailed: Failed to copy, please copy the link manually

enterprise.name: Global Partner
enterprise.tooltip: RelayPulse top sponsor, powering open source operations

api_key_user.label: User API
api_key_user.tooltip: Monitoring API Key sponsored by user

api_key_official.label: Official API
api_key_official.tooltip: Monitoring API Key sponsored by provider

externalLink.title: Leaving RelayPulse
externalLink.thirdPartyNotice: The service provider you are about to visit is operated independently by a third party.
externalLink.riskTip1: Our monitoring data only represents technical connectivity, not an endorsement of merchant credibility or financial security.
externalLink.riskTip2: AI relay services carry inherent industry risks. Please be mindful of fund safety and consider small deposits.

meta.title: API Self-Test
meta.description: Self-test your API endpoint availability and latency

selftest.title: API Self-Test
selftest.description: Test if your API endpoint is working properly, check latency and availability

form.apiUrlHint: HTTPS only, domain names required (IP addresses not supported)
form.apiKeyHint: Your API key is only used for this test and will not be stored

hints.title: Usage Tips
hints.domainOnly: Domain names required, IP addresses not supported
hints.rateLimit: Maximum 10 tests per minute per IP
hints.privacy: API keys are only used for testing and will not be stored or logged
